item.title: How T1 and E1 Lines Compare
item.description: T1 and E1 are two widely used digital line services for voice and data, each prevalent in different geographical regions. While T1 is common in the US, Canada, Japan, and South Korea, E1 dominates Europe and most other parts of the world. The “T” in T1 comes from “T-Carrier,” a standard developed by Bell Labs after World War II for carrying multiple phone calls between switching centers. Similarly, the “E” in E1 stands for “Europe.
